election_record.label: New York 1823 State Senate, District 3

overview.note: "Agreeably to the act of 1821, the person receiving the highest number of votes, is elected for the longest term; of course Mr. Livingston is elected for four years, and Mr. Haight for one." Catskill Recorder (Catskill, NY). November 28, 1823.

Jacob Sutherland had resigned, leaving an open seat. Rather than hold a separate special election, there was one election held, with two candidates running for two seats. However, in spite of the newspaper reports, it would appear that Jacob Heigh was elected for four years, as he served four years, whereas Edward P. Livingston was elected to serve the remaining term of Jacob Sutherland.

sub_unit.name: Columbia
sub_unit.note: Joseph Harris received 1 vote as Joseph Harric.

sub_unit.name: Greene
sub_unit.note: Elisha Williams received 1 vote as E. Williams.

sub_unit.name: Middleburgh
sub_unit.note: Abraham Van Vechten received 1 vote as Abraham Van Veghten.

election_record.reference: Original Manuscript of New York Assembly Elections. Michael J. Dubin.
